remarks: Lemma for ~ archiabl , which requires the group to be both left- and right-ordered.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 13-Apr-2018.)
statement:
archiabllem.b $e |- B = ( Base ` W ) $.
archiabllem.0 $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` W ) $.
archiabllem.e $e |- .<_ = ( le ` W ) $.
archiabllem.t $e |- .< = ( lt ` W ) $.
archiabllem.m $e |- .x. = ( .g ` W ) $.
archiabllem.g $e |- ( ph -> W e. oGrp ) $.
archiabllem.a $e |- ( ph -> W e. Archi ) $.
archiabllem2.1 $e |- .+ = ( +g ` W ) $.
archiabllem2.2 $e |- ( ph -> ( oppG ` W ) e. oGrp ) $.
archiabllem2.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ a e. B /\ .0. .< a ) -> E. b e. B ( .0. .< b /\ b .< a ) ) $.
archiabllem2a.4 $e |- ( ph -> X e. B ) $.
archiabllem2a.5 $e |- ( ph -> .0. .< X ) $.
archiabllem2a $p |- ( ph -> E. c e. B ( .0. .< c /\ ( c .+ c ) .<_ X ) ) $.
$d .+ a b c $.
$d .0. a b $.
$d .0. a b c $.
$d .< a b $.
$d .< a b c $.
$d .<_ a b $.
$d .<_ a b c $.
$d B a b $.
$d B a b c $.
$d W a b $.
$d W a b c $.
$d X a b $.
$d X a b c $.
$d a b $.
$d a b ph $.
